content: by alexis cole acole129@gmail com little present gift card holder & ornament skill level advanced beginner this gift card holder is cute enough to hang on the tree even after the money s been spent pattern essentials tools & materials stitch abbreviations card holder color 1 approx 35 yards 15 grams of blo back loop only any worsted weight 4 yarn chain chain ribbon & bow color 2 approx 5 yards 2 grams of fpdc front post double_crochet any worsted weight 4 yarn single_crochet single_crochet 5 5mm crochet hook skip skip yarn needle slip_stitch slip_stitch scissors st stitch yo yarn over notes gauge 4 stitches x 4 row = 1 x 1 in single_crochet finished size 3 in width 4 in height time to complete 1 hour 20 minutes  use this pattern in any way you like as long as i m credited for the design  the fpdc stitches give the wrapping paper its unique texture  the chain at the beginning of each row does not count as a stitch  the finished product is intended to fit a standard gift card but the size is easily adjusted by adding or subtracting foundation chain in multiples of 2 plus 1 turning chain ~ 1 ~ special stitches front post double_crochet fpdc yo insert your hook from front to back to front around the post of the stitch yo pull yarn through yo pull through 2 loops on hook 2 times in row 3 and 19 fpdc around the single_crochet as shown in photo 1 for all other fpdc stitch around the prior row of fpdc as shown in photo 1 photo 1 photo 2 pattern instructions card holder row 1-15 create the front of the holder and row 18-32 create the back cast on with color 1 chain 10 row 1 single_crochet in second st from hook and in each chain across chain 1 then turn row 2 repeat row 1 row 3 single_crochet 1 fpdc 1 around row 1 single_crochet skip 1 st 4 times single_crochet 1 chain 1 then turn row 4 repeat row 1 row 5 single_crochet 1 fpdc 1 around fpdc from two row back skip 1 st 4 times single_crochet 1 chain 1 then turn row 6-15 repeat row 4 and 5 row 16 single_crochet across in blo chain 1 then turn note the next three row allow the holder to fold in half neatly continuing the textured fpdc across the bottom of the holder would make it difficult to fold row 17 repeat row 1 ~ 2 ~ row 18 repeat row 16 row 19 single_crochet 1 fpdc 1 around row 18 single_crochet skip 1 st 4 times single_crochet 1 chain 1 then turn row 20 repeat row 1 row 21 single_crochet 1 fpdc 1 around fpdc from two row back skip 1 st 4 times single_crochet 1 chain 1 then turn row 22-31 repeat row 19 and 21 row 32 single_crochet 4 chain 1 skip 1 st single_crochet 4 your
